page.title: 14MONKLAW FARM
page.content: {MONKLAW}has been tenanted by Peter Spence for 35 years,helped by his brother.The acreage is 272 which equals 110 hectares. There are about 100 cattle altogether,from calves to three-year olds,mainly blue-greys crossed with Herefords.Peter also has about 160 ewes and 240 lambs.The lambs he sells between New Year and March at St.Boswells where he also buys and sells his cattle. There are about 80 acres of barley,some of which will be used as foodstuff and the rest sold.There are 15 acres of turnips for consumption by the sheep and cattle. Each year he will buy a number of gimmers(18mths old)to be the mothers of the next batch of lambs. Peter has three tractors,two of them Leylands.He keeps a cow for his milk.
